title: Implement vizier v0.2 baseline
description: Deliver the v0.2 spec as a working Rust CLI (vz) with WakeObservation and Observation outputs, watch/diff streaming, platform backends, and validation tests.
notes: Execution order: 1) vizier-ilt.1 bootstrap CLI, 2) vizier-ilt.2 schema types, 3) vizier-ilt.3 observer and waker traits, 4) vizier-ilt.14 fs event deltas, 5) vizier-ilt.13 watch and diff stream, 6) vizier-ilt.15 macOS observer, 7) vizier-ilt.16 Linux observer, 8) vizier-ilt.17 macOS wake, 9) vizier-ilt.18 Linux wake, 10) vizier-ilt.19 CLI flag behavior, 11) vizier-ilt.20 tests, 12) vizier-ilt.21 docs and release sizing.

title: Bootstrap Rust crate and CLI command surface
description: Scaffold Cargo project and module layout from spec. Implement clap command routing for vz wake, vz snapshot, vz watch, interval, diff, pretty, and exit semantics.
acceptance_criteria: cargo build succeeds; vz --help shows required command and flag surface; mode dispatch stubs exist for wake, snapshot, and watch.
close_reason: Implemented in baseline crate: CLI command surface, schema types, observer/waker factories, and working watch diff stream with tests.

title: Implement CLI data/control flags and output polish
description: Implement remaining flags and output behavior: , , , , stdout/stderr split, and exit codes.
acceptance_criteria: Flag behavior matches spec and is covered by tests; errors route to stderr; success path returns 0 and failures return 1.
close_reason: Superseded by cleaned duplicate tasks vizier-ilt.13 through vizier-ilt.21

title: Add schema and behavior test suite
description: Create tests for snapshot/wake schema conformance, diff envelope validity, and minimal platform smoke tests with fixtures/mocks where needed.
acceptance_criteria: covers schema shape and watch diff output format; regression fixtures added for both Observation and WakeObservation.
close_reason: Superseded by cleaned duplicate tasks vizier-ilt.13 through vizier-ilt.21

title: Finalize docs, packaging, and size budget
description: Update README usage docs, build/install notes, and verify stripped release binary size target (<2MB where feasible).
acceptance_criteria: README reflects final CLI and examples; release build instructions validated; size measurement recorded with follow-up if over budget.
close_reason: Superseded by cleaned duplicate tasks vizier-ilt.13 through vizier-ilt.21

title: Build watch loop and JSON Patch diff streaming
description: Implement vz watch runtime with interval polling, initial full snapshot, and RFC6902 envelope output for diff mode.
acceptance_criteria: watch emits NDJSON snapshots; diff mode emits full snapshot then patch envelopes with ts and monotonic_ms; patch stream is valid JSON.
close_reason: Implemented in baseline crate: CLI command surface, schema types, observer/waker factories, and working watch diff stream with tests.

title: Integrate filesystem event delta collection
description: Wire notify to collect filesystem events between observations with configurable watch path and bounded event buffers.
acceptance_criteria: First snapshot emits empty fs_events; subsequent snapshots contain create modify delete rename events since prior tick; watch-path override works.
close_reason: Integrated notify-backed filesystem delta collection with first-snapshot empty behavior and watch-path support in baseline observer.

title: Implement macOS live observer backend
description: Implement macOS Observer using Core Graphics and libproc for focus, windows, displays, cursor, idle, terminal context, and network connections.
acceptance_criteria: On macOS snapshot returns non-empty focus, windows, and displays when GUI active; idle_ms and cursor populate; terminal context appears for focused terminal windows.
close_reason: Implemented macOS-specific observer and wake collectors with baseline fallback: CoreGraphics display/window probes, cursor and idle enrichment, gateway/DNS/groups/session enrichment, GPU metadata, and lsof-backed network/listening data.

title: Implement Linux live observer backend (Hyprland plus X11 fallback)
description: Implement Linux Observer with Hyprland IPC primary and xcb EWMH fallback. Add proc parsing for connections and terminal cwd.
acceptance_criteria: With Hyprland, focus and window enumeration work via IPC; without Hyprland, X11 fallback resolves active window and client stack; net_connections populate from proc.
notes: Implemented Linux observer with Hyprland IPC enrichment (clients, activewindow, monitors) and baseline fallback; pending runtime verification on Linux host.

title: Implement macOS wake collector
description: Implement WakeObservation on macOS for machine, user, datetime, filesystem, apps, network identity, listening ports, resources, recent activity, and other sessions.
acceptance_criteria: vz wake on macOS serializes all top-level wake fields; public_ip can be omitted with no-public-ip; collector remains read-only.
close_reason: Implemented macOS-specific observer and wake collectors with baseline fallback: CoreGraphics display/window probes, cursor and idle enrichment, gateway/DNS/groups/session enrichment, GPU metadata, and lsof-backed network/listening data.

title: Implement Linux wake collector
description: Implement WakeObservation on Linux using proc data, os-release, mounts, PATH app scans, network interfaces, shell history, and utmp sessions.
acceptance_criteria: vz wake on Linux returns full wake payload with safe defaults when privileged data is unavailable; listening port and resource collectors work without root.
notes: Implemented Linux wake enrichment from os-release, DMI, route, uptime, who sessions, and GPU probes; pending runtime verification on Linux host.

title: Implement CLI flags and output behavior
description: Implement remaining flags and output behavior: pretty formatting, all-connections, no-public-ip, watch-path, stdout and stderr split, and exit codes.
acceptance_criteria: Flag behavior matches spec and is covered by tests; errors route to stderr; success returns 0 and failures return 1.
notes: Changed wake output profile: compact mode is now default, and full unpruned wake payload is available via --verbose. Added CLI tests for compact default and verbose expansion.
close_reason: Implemented CLI flag behavior and added CLI/schema/diff integration tests covering no-public-ip, all-connections, watch diff stream, and command surface.

title: Define versioned JSON schemas
description: Implement Observation, WakeObservation, and nested structs in observation.rs with serde derives and stable field names and types from spec.
acceptance_criteria: All root and nested schema types compile; schema_version field present; JSON serialization round-trips for representative fixtures.
close_reason: Implemented in baseline crate: CLI command surface, schema types, observer/waker factories, and working watch diff stream with tests.

title: Add schema and behavior test suite
description: Create tests for snapshot and wake schema conformance, diff envelope validity, and minimal platform smoke tests with fixtures or mocks.
acceptance_criteria: cargo test covers schema shape and watch diff output format; regression fixtures added for Observation and WakeObservation.
close_reason: Implemented CLI flag behavior and added CLI/schema/diff integration tests covering no-public-ip, all-connections, watch diff stream, and command surface.

title: Finalize docs packaging and size budget
description: Update README usage docs and build notes, and verify stripped release binary size target under two megabytes where feasible.
acceptance_criteria: README reflects final CLI and examples; release build instructions validated; size measurement recorded with follow-up if over budget.
close_reason: Updated README with CLI/build/test docs, validated release build steps, and recorded current release size (3.9MB) with explicit note that it exceeds the 2MB target.

title: Implement observer/waker traits and platform factories
description: Add Observer and Waker traits and create_observer and create_waker factory wiring with cfg-targeted backends.
acceptance_criteria: Factory selection compiles for target OS; trait-based dispatch used by CLI; unsupported platform paths fail cleanly.
close_reason: Implemented in baseline crate: CLI command surface, schema types, observer/waker factories, and working watch diff stream with tests.

title: Build watch loop and JSON Patch diff streaming
description: Implement  runtime with interval polling, initial full snapshot, and RFC6902 envelope output for .
acceptance_criteria: emits NDJSON snapshots;  emits full snapshot then patch envelopes with ts/monotonic_ms; patch stream is valid JSON.
close_reason: Superseded by cleaned duplicate tasks vizier-ilt.13 through vizier-ilt.21

title: Integrate filesystem event delta collection
description: Wire  to collect fs events between observations with configurable watch path and bounded event buffers.
acceptance_criteria: First snapshot emits empty fs_events; subsequent snapshots contain create/modify/delete/rename events since prior tick;  works.
close_reason: Superseded by cleaned duplicate tasks vizier-ilt.13 through vizier-ilt.21

acceptance_criteria: On macOS, snapshot returns non-empty focus/windows/displays when GUI active; idle_ms and cursor populate; terminal context appears for focused terminal windows.
close_reason: Superseded by cleaned duplicate tasks vizier-ilt.13 through vizier-ilt.21

description: Implement Linux Observer path with Hyprland IPC primary and xcb/EWMH fallback. Add /proc parsing for connections and terminal cwd.
acceptance_criteria: With Hyprland, focus/window enumeration works via IPC; without Hyprland, X11 fallback resolves active window and stacked clients; net_connections populated from /proc.

title: Implement macOS wake collector
description: Implement WakeObservation on macOS for machine/user/datetime/filesystem/apps/network identity/listening ports/resources/recent activity/other sessions.
acceptance_criteria: on macOS serializes all top-level wake fields; optional  can be omitted with ; no persistent side effects.
close_reason: Superseded by cleaned duplicate tasks vizier-ilt.13 through vizier-ilt.21

title: Implement Linux wake collector
description: Implement WakeObservation on Linux using /proc, /etc/os-release, mounts, PATH/app scans, network interfaces, history/session parsing.
acceptance_criteria: on Linux returns full wake payload with sane defaults when privileged data unavailable; listening port + resource collectors work without root.
close_reason: Superseded by cleaned duplicate tasks vizier-ilt.13 through vizier-ilt.21
